People complained about ‚Äúbaseload power‚Äù and about price, about Pacomm and about Waikiki. It was hard work, it got bumpy at times, and we are not nearly done, but given the success of Hawaii‚Äôs clean energy initiative, there‚Äôs no reason to be afraid of a clean energy future.

A couple of years ago the legislature made a law for 100 percent clean energy generation. Even the utility company likes it, because they are transforming. What I am saying is this can be done, and it must be done. Don‚Äôt be afraid. Be optimistic. America can figure this out.

Then, the same thing kept happening. Every time we raised the number, we kept exceeding the number! And prices went down, not up. So, now we‚Äôve got our local biz leaders loving it, selling it, and everyone‚Äôs bought in.

Something pretty incredible happened. We hit our targets. We exceeded our targets. The price of electricity went down, not up. We brought in investors, & small businesses thrived. The building trades liked it. A lot. So, we got more ambitious, a plan with teeth, and bigger goal.

When Hawaii started its clean energy program in 1998 we had a weak but aspirational law to try to double clean energy. It was attacked by the utility and the biz community as too much too soon, and by green groups as too little. But, it was a start.
